summary: The Rural Housing Service Reform Act of 2025 aims to reform rural housing programs. Key provisions include streamlining procedures, authorizing appropriations for staffing and IT upgrades, establishing a housing preservation and revitalization program, modifying loans and grants for farm housing improvements, providing rural community development initiative grants, establishing reporting requirements, adjusting the rural housing voucher program, facilitating transfers to nonprofit organizations, extending loan terms, and addressing accessory dwelling units. The act also sets a time frame for application review.
